docs.snippet: Price changes were mixed in the foreign exchange market last week, but the strength of the Canadian free dollar and the good demand for the pound sterling overshadowed the irregularity of the Mexican peso and the Holland guilder. Elsewhere, Swiss...
docs.lead_paragraph: Price changes were mixed in the foreign exchange market last week, but the strength of the Canadian free dollar and the good demand for the pound sterling overshadowed the irregularity of the Mexican peso and the Holland guilder. Elsewhere, Swiss free franc continued dull, with insignificant changes in several South Americans.

docs.snippet: Development and modernization of agriculture in Brazil would go a long way toward making that nation prosperous, according to John Abbink, co-chairman of the Joint Brazil - United States Economic Mission that is preparing a report on the Brazilian...
docs.lead_paragraph: Development and modernization of agriculture in Brazil would go a long way toward making that nation prosperous, according to John Abbink, co-chairman of the Joint Brazil - United States Economic Mission that is preparing a report on the Brazilian economy.
docs.abstract: Abbink says industrialization should be preceded by agr improvements

headline.main: IMPROVE FARMS FOR BRAZIL URGED; Development Asked by Abbink, Co-Chairman of Economic Mission of Two Nations

docs.snippet: Pound sterling last week suffered its first reverse since the new year when heavy offerings by oil and motion-picture companies struck the rate down to $4.03, lowest since Jan. 5.
docs.lead_paragraph: Pound sterling last week suffered its first reverse since the new year when heavy offerings by oil and motion-picture companies struck the rate down to $4.03, lowest since Jan. 5.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Feb. 25, 1949

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 4 -- The State Department announced today that the United States would not appoint a representative to the American Committee on Dependent Territories, which will meet at Havana on March 15 to consider measures for inducing European...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 4 -- The State Department announced today that the United States would not appoint a representative to the American Committee on Dependent Territories, which will meet at Havana on March 15 to consider measures for inducing European countries to relinquish their colonies or other dependent territories in the Western hemisphere.
docs.abstract: US not to send reprs; disagreement with conf aims noted

headline.main: U. S. NOT TO JOIN TALK ON AMERICA COLONIES

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES -- Having played host last month to the Inter-American Travel Congress for the first time, South America is newly conscious of its possibilities as a place for vacationing nortecamericanos to spend their dollars.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES -- Having played host last month to the Inter-American Travel Congress for the first time, South America is newly conscious of its possibilities as a place for vacationing nortecamericanos to spend their dollars.

docs.snippet: THIS year's European traveler may take encouragement from the fact that the formidable barriers of red tape raised at national borders are finally beginning to shrink. Great Britain, Belgium and Italy all dropped their visa requirements during the...
docs.lead_paragraph: THIS year's European traveler may take encouragement from the fact that the formidable barriers of red tape raised at national borders are finally beginning to shrink. Great Britain, Belgium and Italy all dropped their visa requirements during the last year for American tourists, joining Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Switzerland, Denmark, Norway and Sweden in admitting visitors on valid United States passports alone.

headline.main: PASSPORT AND VISAS; Red Tape Eased a Bit, but Even So Tourist Must Have a Pocketful of Documents

docs.snippet: Good buying of the Canadian free dollar lifted that currency to 93.44 cents, last week, a new peak since October 8, last. Buying originated with out of town banks and was later shared by local institutions. The combination quickly accounted for the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Good buying of the Canadian free dollar lifted that currency to 93.44 cents, last week, a new peak since October 8, last. Buying originated with out of town banks and was later shared by local institutions. The combination quickly accounted for the advance. Supply was noticeably light.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week ended March 4, 1949

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES. ASK an ardent peronista why Truman was elected and he will echo the afternoon paper, La Epoca: "Because his social ideas were just like Peron's." An Argentine intellectual who opposes the regime but who was in the United States last...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES. ASK an ardent peronista why Truman was elected and he will echo the afternoon paper, La Epoca: "Because his social ideas were just like Peron's." An Argentine intellectual who opposes the regime but who was in the United States last October and November said, "Frankly, the Truman campaign ended up as demagogically as Peron's in 1946."
docs.abstract: M Bracker article on effect on US relations of Argentine temperament and outlook

headline.main: A Survey of the Argentine Mind; The people mistrust us and see us as the only barrier to their ascendancy in the Hemisphere.

docs.snippet: THIS year's stamp-issuing program is expected to include a postal item to direct public attention to the national campaign against cancer. It was learned last week that Eric A. Johnston, president of the American Cancer Society, wrote President...
docs.lead_paragraph: THIS year's stamp-issuing program is expected to include a postal item to direct public attention to the national campaign against cancer. It was learned last week that Eric A. Johnston, president of the American Cancer Society, wrote President Truman several months ago requesting that such a stamp be issued and that the President forwarded the letter, with his approval, to Postmaster General Jesse M. Donaldson.
docs.abstract: Czech P O Hvieszdoslav por item planned

headline.main: NEWS OF THE WORLD OF STAMPS; Designs for Cancer Society Commemorative Offered To Postmaster General

docs.snippet: Postponement of play in the international chess masters tournament has been necessitated by the late arrival of Arturito Pomar, 17- year-old Spanish master, according to a report from Buenos Aires. Pomar, who has met many of the leading European...
docs.lead_paragraph: Postponement of play in the international chess masters tournament has been necessitated by the late arrival of Arturito Pomar, 17- year-old Spanish master, according to a report from Buenos Aires. Pomar, who has met many of the leading European experts in tournaments, is due from Madrid today.

headline.main: CHESS START POSTPONED; Play in Buenos Aires Masters Event Slated Tomorrow
